reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very fun game always action never any down time. Its a great game to play if you dont have much time on your hands just hop on and play a couple of matches.

You get to collect alot of different monsters to fight along side you. Each of the monsters has there own abilities and feel unique from one another.

The difficulty curve is very well done as every level you play gets harder but not too hard and it doesnt get too easy (unless if your some pro which i am no where near)

(NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOT PAY TO WIN)

In pvp every monster is boosted to level 10 so they all have generally the same stats all tho some monsters are better then others just based on there abilities. With that being said, it doesnt matter if your team is better then the other players yeah it will help you a little bit but skill is a huge factor in pvp because if you're faster you'll charge your abilities faster and probably win.

Each ability is a little mini game in its self which is pretty fun.Sling shot bombs into targets, Quick time events and alot more.

Overall for a free game its very good. You dont need to pay and skill wins in the end.

If you got some free time i suggest you check it out.

Enjoy :)
voteText: 13 of 18 people (72%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

This game is great when trying to kill time it uses a system similar to bejewled but then there are so many other layers to it such as the teams which work REALLY WELL, it adds a dimension to the game that makes it enjoyable and also makes it feel unique. the micro transaction arnt too in your face but they are there and using them can get you other team members but its not required to do well. The graphics are nice, the art style is nice and the gameplay just works really well its a really good game and for free its even better

I would also like the see some Australian/New Zealand servers as i was only getting games with the asian server this had very little impact on the game though even at more than 200 ping

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

I have played this game for only about 15 hours so you could say I'm quite new to this game but here are the things that I have seen so far.

Since this is a free to play game that means it is a P2W game right?Well your wrong,since the only thing that money can get you in this game is faster progress compared to the free to play player.All you can get is minions and you will be able to get them all as a F2P player later on down the line.

PvP is fair since all of your and opponents minions are level 10,the only thing that will influence who wins is who is faster and who has the best party lined up.

Apart from that the music,animations and graphics are all perfectly done.I have totally fallen in love with this game as you can be a casual player or a competitive player this game supplies the needs for both players.

I don't know about you but if a game is free and is not P2W I would definately atleast give it a try since you don't lose anything.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun and Addictive Game.

Pros:
- Unique combination of game features like Angry Birds, Candy Crash even HearthStone and many other mini games.
- NOT turned based and win still depends on fast fingers and eyes.
- Unique upgradable minions and minion combinations, which makes possible different play styles and combos.
- Story mode and PVP with its ranking system (YES PVP O_O ).
- NOT pay to win.
- Tradable drops and gifts. Some 'Mystic' drops are also marketable.

Cons:
- Needs Proper tutorial, spell and minion descriptions, as I spent many matches not knowing what some abilities did and how they charged.
- Sometimes some animations prevent you from your already begun turns, forcing you to repeat them.
- The story mode seems repeatable and needs more creativity.

Final score: 8/10.
Already Fun game with more potential.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ember Strike is a neat free to play game all about swapping different elements on the board to charge up your monsters ability to damage your opponent. The biggest and most important difference between ember strike and other games of this genre are that between you and your opponent there are no turns, you each have to swap and attack as fast as you can.

Fast gameplay is neat, but couple it with full single player and you get a well rounded single/multi -player experience that many are sure to enjoy. that being said such broad appeal is hard to recommend to a single type of player. so if you think you might enjoy it, give it a try, it seems to be a really high quality free to play game for now. hope it only gets better from here on.

I love Ember Strike.  Its challenging and I like that the attacks aren't automatic hits/crits like in a game such as pokemon, you actually have to have accuracy if you want to advance and/or gain new friends to fight on your side.  It looks like there is a lot of people to unlock and I plan on playing this game some more, so we will see how long this game takes to complete, but it is very catchy and easy to get into.  Even though there is pressure to find the 3 or 4 symbols to match up, I would say this is a more laidback, relaxing game and I highly recommend it to everyone.  10/10 and its free.  So please give it a try.  You wont regret it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Initially, this seemed like a great game - the action is fast paced, chaotic, and fairly addictive. New minions are thrown to you regularly, until... they're not. After about the first 8 minions, I hit an absolute brick wall. The PvE doesnt give you nearly enough coins to level your minions (currently the enemies I'm facing are 15!!! team levels above me), and it takes 20 stages to earn enough embers to get a new minion.

The only way to progress at this point seems to be to boost through microtransactions, something I'm not willing to do.

PvP is fun up to a point - they've balanced it reasonably well by having all minions be considered lvl 10 on both sides, however team comp plays a HUGE part, and with the aforementioned lack of minions without paying, you might be lucky to have 1 group of 5 that work together well out of your 8 or so minions.

Unless you are willing to pull out your wallet, or mindlessly grind lower levels for weeks in order to get 1 new minion, or level enough to beat 1 extra stage, then stay clear of this title.

Cons:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

1.  Playing the PvE is fun until you have to either A) Play PvP or B) Buy gems with money to level up your minions
2.  Playing PvP is fun until you run into players that are cheating.  (ie: Bot that auto-matches)
3.  You get stuck in the PvE because you choose not to spend real life money to level up your minions.  I've grinded PvP and have leveled up my minions to level 11 this way.
4.  Once you start getting further into PvE, somehow your minions do ~75% less damage, forcing you to level up your minions to get past some points.

- Postive Side -
The game is fun for a quick 30minutes to 1hour interval.   After that, find something else because you'll get upset.
voteText: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So here's the problem I have with this game. There are limited ways to earn embers, which aside from purchasing gems is the primary way of unlocking minions. After about level 6 on each minion and with maybe two unlocked, the difference between your minions and the NPCs or sometimes other player characters become apparent.

You have to grind matches either against the pc (that you've already won) at a greatly reduced gold intake, or do pvp matches against other players for a decent payout. If you lose either, you get nothing.

There are some bonus missions that can be done for extra embers, but they may not be ones you can complete - for example, do 10 moon attacks in winning pvp matches. I don't even have a moon minion, and withour earning embers (or spending real $$ on gems) who knows when I'll have one?

I see this game as a huge time sink with little rewards, though it is fun enough on the surface.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nOne of the worse free to play's availabel on steam honestly. The company clearly put no effort in to porting it from ios(mentions tapping in every instruction and the ui is painfully ios) in addition to being a game that doesnt even deserve ios. It's a 1 on 1 match 3 game in real time with small monsters that attack using the stones you match. unfortunately, using these attacks can make you unable to match for the animations which last far too long and the game never bothers to teach you how the second type of attack each monster has works. May not sound like a lot of issues, but thats the whole game so there isnt a single pro to it.
